result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Larimore- rcvd complaint. waives reading. waives time limits on preliminary hearing.
Court - sets prelim on 1/13/23 at 11:30 AM. All remaining cases to be set a status hearings tagging along.

22TR1272 - Motion to Reopen
Atty Larimore - argues for matter to be reopened.
State - speaks of testimony to be heard or offer of proof. Will defer to Court. Issue is if DE was served the refusal paperwork or not.
Court - will hear testimony.
11:40 AM - Atty Larimore calls Mitchell Ludtke. Witness is sworn in and testifies.
State - cross examines witness.  Atty Larimore - redirect 11:48 AM witness is excused.
11:48 AM - State calls Dept Samantha Caress. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Offers Ex #1, #2, #3. Atty Larimore - no objection. Court rcvs Ex #1, #2, #3
Atty Larimore - cross examines.  State - re direct.  12:00 PM witness is excused.
State - asks court to take judicial notice in 22CM26 and 22CF03. Court - takes Judicial notice.  Atty Larimore - argues for Court to grant motion. State - argues against motion
Court - denies motion to reopen
Atty Larimore - asks for status

State - req $1,000 cash bond. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns.

Court - orders $500 cash bond.  Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Court - orders $1,250 cash bond. All remaining conditions will remain.

22CM26 - Bond
State - asks for bond to be modified from $1,500 sign bond to $1,000 cash bond
Atty Tomtschik - asks for bonds to remain as is.
Court - orders $750 cash. All remaining conditions will remain.
